pages: Notice Public Act, 1963Validation and Publication Date, 1963 6 28Amendment of the Nepal Act 2064 2064 5 9Consolidation and amendment of some Nepal Census 2Amendment of the Nepal Act 2066 2066 10 Amendment of the 7th Nepal Act 11 Amendment of some Nepal Acts to adapt Nepal's Constitution 133 11 The 1963 Act No. No. 3 regulates public relations in order to control cyber-promotion and corruption proceedings and to ensure the authenticity of the person who signs the instrument in writing. The Act was promulgated by the House of Representatives in the first year of its enactment, 1963, when the Notary Public Act became lawful for the purpose of ensuring the public interest in the administration of the translation of documents in a manner which is in the public interest. summary: The text discusses the Notary Public Act of 2063 in Nepal, along with subsequent amendments and laws related to legal procedures and documentation. It outlines the establishment and functions of the Notary Public, emphasizing the importance of proper documentation and verification for legal purposes. The Act also defines key terms and procedures for creating and transferring legal rights and responsibilities. The document highlights the role of the Notary Public in ensuring the authenticity and legality of official documents.

summary: The text discusses the provisions of the Judicial Council Act 2073, which outlines the duties and powers of the Judicial Council in Nepal. It includes the appointment of judges, disciplinary actions, and recommendations on judicial administration. The Act also specifies the qualifications for judges and the process for their appointment. Additionally, it mandates the preparation of a list of eligible Nepali citizens for judicial positions. The Act emphasizes the importance of following the Constitution in all judicial matters.

summary: The text is a legal document related to the Nepal Judicial Council Regulations of 2074. It outlines the procedures and requirements for the appointment and responsibilities of judges in various courts. The regulations also specify the qualifications and procedures for the appointment of judicial officers and legal professionals. The document emphasizes the importance of maintaining accurate records and information related to judicial appointments and legal proceedings.

Some Nepal Amendment Act2025 11 19 Ordinance to Amend 2 Acts on Criminal Offences and Criminal Procedure 1977 1977 331 Legislation to amend and unify the Law on Judicial Administration: Establishment of jurisdiction of courts in accordance with Nepal's Constitution and fast processing of judges, universal impartiality Since it is necessary to amend and unify in due time the existing laws relating to the administration of justice, in accordance with section 266 of the Nepalese Constitution, the Parliament has amended sub-section (1) of this Six&paragraph 1The name of the initial act is "Judicial Administration Act No. Abbreviations and Introduction: (12) This Act will begin with the notification register of the Nepal government published by Nepal. ^Definition: If the subject or context does not have any other meaning in this Act - 2"Adalat" is the highest The courts will remember the High Court and District Courts from the date specified by this Act (from Nepal to 6 3Prints in the Gazette2248 5 29

"judge" means "judge of the court of the court" or "judge" means "judge of the court" or "judge of the court" means "judge of the court" or "judge" means "judge of the court" "Court of Justice" means the Court of Justice in accordance with Article 153 of the Constitution. "Constitution" means the Constitution of Nepal. There will be a District Court in the district (the establishment of 9 District Courts) and 3 District Courts will be located in the district offices of the district offices of the district offices of the district offices of the district offices of the district offices. There will be a District Judge in each District Court, even if it is written that there will be a District Judge in any District Court. Under the overall ceiling established that the Chief Justice may appoint additional District Judges to the requisite number on the recommendation of the Judiciary Council, the Judiciary Council shall, in accordance with subparagraph (7(3) of the ongoing workload, appoint each District Judge The number of judges sitting in the courts may be determined accordingly, and the number of judges who have been determined accordingly may be reduced according to the workload.

summary: The text discusses the legal provisions related to the establishment of district courts and high courts in Nepal under the Justice Administration Act of 2073. It also outlines the roles and responsibilities of judges in these courts, including the appointment process and the determination of their numbers based on workload. The Act aims to streamline the judicial system in Nepal and ensure efficient and impartial justice delivery.

summary: The text discusses the provisions of the Legal Service Commission Act, 2073 in Nepal, outlining the duties and powers of the commission. It includes amendments related to the appointment of officials, recommendations for departmental penalties, and the conduct of examinations for district judges. The Act aims to modify and integrate existing laws in accordance with the Constitution of Nepal. The Act also defines key terms such as "Chairperson," "Commission," and "Service." The functioning and operations of the commission are detailed, including the establishment of a secretariat and the conduct of meetings.
